statement.p: Reshanda is conducting market research on the cost of homeowners insurance. Reshanda has determined that the average annual cost of homeowners insurance is 1164, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 80.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends less than 1246 on homeowners insurance.
b. The cost of the middle 40 of homeowners insurance policies falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 20 of homeowners insurance policies cost at least how much annually?
